About

Hi, I'm Jot! I am driven to make a lasting impact at the intersection of data science, biology, and public health.

I am currently purusing a Master of Science degree in Quantitative Biology and Bioinformatics at Carnegie Mellon University. I have a rare blend of wet-lab experience, clinical research insights, and computational skills.

I've collaborated with bench scientists in biotechnology to develop innovative contamination detection methods. My expertise includes data science with analyzing big datasets, including epidemiological studies with over 3,000 participants. Currently, I am leveraging metagenomic data for public health intiatives in Dr. Catherine Armbruster's Laboratory.
